comments:
1. The project root folder is source folder.
2. There two/three source folders inside, name them: temp 1,
temp 2, temp 3.
3. There are exclusion filters for the inner source folders
in the root source folder.
4. The output folder is enabled and the inner source folders
has some custom source folders names. The root source folder
is left with the default source folder 'bin'. If the inner
source folders use the default source folder, the JDT has
another bug and clears the output folder checkbox - all
classes are generated along the .java files.
5. Add some class and a package in one of the source folders.
6. Try to rename the source folder. An error dialog shows
reporting exception of null argument; After this the new
folder is created but hasn't been added to the build path.

The exception which is thrown is the following:
